summary:
Gaul was an ancient region in Western Europe, covering modern-day France and parts of nearby countries. The Romans divided it into three main areas: Gallia Celtica, Belgica, and Aquitania. It was known for the Gauls, who had a unique culture called La TÃ¨ne.

The Gauls once attacked and sacked Rome. Later, the Romans conquered Gaul, starting in 204 BC. Julius Caesar finished the conquest in 51 BC. Roman rule lasted until the 5th century AD when the Franks took over. The region then became known as France.
title: Gaul
